meanings.definition: The quality or state of being foolish or stupid.
meanings.sent1: His doltishnesses were evident in his inability to understand simple instructions.
meanings.sent2: Her constant doltishnesses often led to embarrassing situations.
meanings.sent3: Despite his doltishnesses, he always managed to make us laugh with his silly mistakes.
meanings.sent4: The doltishnesses of the character added a comedic touch to the play.
meanings.sent5: The doltishnesses of the villain made him a lovable, albeit clueless, character.

meanings.definition: Actions or behavior that are characterized by stupidity or lack of intelligence.
meanings.sent1: The team's doltishnesses cost them the game.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but cringe at the doltishnesses of her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The doltishnesses of the puppy chasing its own tail never failed to amuse.
meanings.sent4: The doltishnesses of the situation were like a dark cloud hanging over them.
meanings.sent5: The doltishnesses of the plan were painfully obvious to everyone except the planner.
